item.title: Colleen add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "How often do we tell our own life story? How often do we adjust, embellish, make sly cuts? And the longer life goes on, the fewer are those around to challenge our account, to remind us that our life is not our life, merely the story we have told about our life. Told to others, but&mdash;mainly&mdash;to ourselves." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Colleen add a quote by David Hockney
item.description: "I think I’m greedy, but I’m not greedy for money - I think that can be a burden - I’m greedy for an exciting life." -- David Hockney

item.title: Colleen add a quote by George Sand
item.description: "Guard well within yourself that treasure, kindness. Know how to give without hesitation, how to lose without regret, how to acquire without meanness." -- George Sand

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "And if my heart be scarred and burned, The safer, I, for all I learned." -- Dorothy Parker
